intro: Appendicula celebica, commonly known as the Celebes appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly pubescent underside. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
